general_advisory: As per the extended range forecast of IMD, MC, Bhubaneswar, minimum temperature (night temperature) very likely to be 18 -20°C in some parts of South Odisha, 14 -16°C in most parts of Coastal Odisha and some parts of Interior Odisha and 10 -14°C over the remaining parts of Interior Odisha during week -1 (20th to 26th December, 2024). Minimum temperature very likely to be normal to above normal over the districts of Odisha and very light to light rain very likely to occur over Coastal Odisha & adjoining districts of Interior Odisha during that period. Overall Rainfall activity very likely to be normal to above normal over the state during week -1.

advisory: Farmers should start field preparation for summer season rice cultivation. For this purpose farmers may select some improved varieties like MTU 1010, MTU 1156, MTU 1001, Lalat, Improved Lalat, Chandan, Swarna, etc.

One week before sowing of green gram / black gram crop, seed should be treated with carbendazim @ 1.5 - 2.0g and imidacloprid @ 5g per kg seeds. Seven days after this treatment, 200g Rizobium culture and 3 - 4g sodium molybdate should be mixed in 10kg seeds in 400ml of water and mixed it thoroughly and dry it in shade for half an hour then go for sowing in field. Seed should be sown with a seed rate of 8-10 kg/ac with a spacing of 30cm×10cm. Varieties: Green Gram: - Kamadeva, Durga, IPM 02-3, IPM 02-14, TARM1. Black Gram: - Prasada, Usala, PU 31, IPU2-43, Mahuri. Avoid irrigation for some days because some amount of rainfall is expected in the upcoming week.

Farmers who have not yet sown seeds can use improved Groundnut varieties such as TAG-24, JL-24, Girnar-3, Smruti, TG-3, TG-22, Kadri-5, Kadri-6, Kadri-9, TPG-41, GPBD-4, Devi, CO-7, Dharani and Divya etc. All these varieties are harvested within 100 to 130 days. Ensure seed treatment before sowing of seed and if possible, treat with bacteria or phospho culture 7 days after treatment. For 10 kg of seed, the farmer can use 200 grams of rhizobium culture and 200 grams of phospho culture within 3 hours of sowing. 40 to 50 kg of seed or 60 to 70 kg of pod is required per acre. Seeds should be sown within 2 to 3 days of husking at a depth of 5 cm. If the seedlings are of 10 days old, it is recommended to conduct gap filling where the seedlings have not emerged. Past weather condition is favorable for insect attack in groundnut crop so its regular monitoring should be advised.

Straw can be used as mulching material in vegetable crops to soil maintain moisture as well as soil temperature in field during the winter season. Regular monitoring against the attack of Diamond back moth in cauliflower should be advised and if possible, farmers should use pheromone trap in the field for this purpose. If an attack is observed then spraying of neem oil @ 5 ml or Emamectin Benzoate @ 0.4 g per liter water should be advised after the occurrence of rain.

Farmers should make provision to protect the animal from cold (if possible use jute bag to cover the animal and straw as bedding material) during the winter season and provide clean drinking water to cattle and keep their sheds clean. Don’t allow the urine or excreta to deposit around the shed which may lead to flies and make provision to restrict the entry of rainwater into the shed. Vaccination and deworming should be done to control different harmful diseases and stomach worms.

Proper ventilation is required to provide fresh air and removing gases inside the house. External heat source is provided to keep the poultry shed warm and dry. Various types and layers of curtains and jute bags are used to insulate the farm. The drinking water should be maintained at a suitable temperature to promote water intake.
